chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Casey L Eastman
Current: P.O. Box 282, Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution, Plymouth, WI 53073 United States  (Effective: 07-11-2016)
Prior: P.O. Box 700, Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States

Defendant Casey L Eastman in court with attorney Kerry A. Kelm.  Defendant Casey L Eastman in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 15CF226, 13CM430, 15CF109, 15CF113.
State relates all cases to be heard together today.  
Attorney Kelm relates joint agreement on all cases.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court reviews Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights with defendant. 

15CF226:  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant and accepts waiver, finds probable cause, and binds defendant over.  Information filed.  Defendant waives reading of Information.   Defendant enters Guilty plea on Count 1.  Court accepts and finds Guilty to Count 1.  

15CF109: Court orders All Counts - DRI.

15CF113: Defendant enters Guilty Plea to Count 9.  Court accepts and finds Guilty to Count 9.  Court orders Count 10 and Count 11 - DRI.  

13CM430: Court orders DRI.

Court orders PSI.
Bond revoked.  Remanded into custody until sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
7/22/15 Request to Judge Bitney from Attorney Kelm to reset hearings scheduled on 8/12/15.

Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF113, 15CF109, 15CF226 and 13CM430 called.  Attorney Kelm relates. Court relates. Court instructs that someone will need to either prepare a writ to have the defendant here or arrangement for him to appear by video conference.  
13CM430 - Plea hearing 8/12/15 at 3:30 pm
15CF109 and 15CF113 - Arraignment 8/12/15 at 3:30 pm
15CF226 - Initial appearance and preliminary hearing 8/12/15 at 3:30 pm

Defendant Casey L Eastman in court by video conference from Dodge Correctional with attorney Kerry A Kelm in court.  Defendant Casey L Eastman in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
13CM430, 15CF109, 15CF113 and 15CF226 called.  Attorney Kelm to forward copy of the new Complaint to her client.  All files reset -  Initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Casey L Eastman in court with attorney Kerry A. Kelm who appears by phone.  Defendant Casey L Eastman in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond modification to allow contact with Catherine T. so long as Defendant is in custody.  Arraignment scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
